caption: Laid-back atmosphere, extremely friendly service, and well-crafted menu items.
The food is always amazing and full of authentic flavor.  Drinks are on point and staff is awesome! Great little spot!

Nice little spot that is away from the hustle and bustle that is inside of armature works. Nice artwork and very friendly staff as well. The xochitl steak bowl and xochitl fries were great. The steak bowl was a great value. The shrimp tacos were extremely underwhelming in flavor and overpriced at $15. The fries were more like very large potato wedges and it was a pleasant surprise. The booth we sat at was missing button covers on the seat and pulled my girlfriend’s hair out, so be cautious if you have long hair. All in all I’d eat here again, but would definitely skip the tacos.
Liars - they never even had the courtesy to respond yes or no to my job application. I would give them a big fat zero. The Goose Egg. Nothing!

They have changed the menu and unfortunately not for the better.  When they first opened they really had some great flavors but the cilantro cremas and such have left the menu, maybe results of Covid cutbacks.  The queso is actually beer cheese now, strange, not sure when that change was made.  3 stars for fast service.
My cat makes better tacos... And I watch staff walk by a plate and napkins all over the place seven times and it still sits there..
Great place to hang out with friends, great staff!!

Very nice staff. Let us watch Superbowl from outside seating even though we didnt have reservations. Go Bucs! I ate shrimp taco which were very tasty. My daughter has a grilled chicken bowl. Looked delicious!
Great food!!
Poor service. Small menu.
Taz&Jacqueline&James were Awesome and so was the Food!
Love the decor.  Cauliflower bowl was excellent. Fair prices and ample servings .
Excellent tacos, bowls, chips and salsa, cold Modelo on draft...you can tell I had too many lol. Will definitely be back..

Bad service and bad food. Our waitress was not friendly whatsoever. Seemed annoyed if we asked for a side of sour cream. The food was not great and lacked flavor, Tampa has so many better taco options. The queso was small and tasted like the Tostito jar queso. Margarita was alright. On Tuesdays they offer a taco Tuesday, $20 for three tacos and a margarita. Well it used to be $15 for this deal but assuming they raised the prices for the Super Bowl. And then the waitress tried to rush us out as soon as we finished eating. Don’t waste your time or money.
Our waitress Raquel was so much fun! The food was very good. Highly recommend the portobello taco for vegetarians. My fiancé loved the shrimp tacos!
Great food, amazing service!  Wonderful staff with amazing people! If you wanna have a great time with good people come to Xochitl for a great time!
Amazing!!! Great location just a stones throw away from Armature Works, everything is reasonable!!! Try the nachos, and ask for the house made salsa on the side!!!
Great food and great service! Sweet waitress with pink sequined mask was so awesome

Such an amazing atmosphere! Amazing owner and staff, very helpful and welcoming! Loved the feel of the spot and the food and drinks are amazzzzzzing! So thankful for our friends bday! Toni and Neil were amazing! Thank you for making it an unforgettable experience!
The service and food was delightful here! We can’t wait to come back! Highly recommend!

Excellent local place. Great atmosphere, incredible food, creative drinks, local art - the whole package. The owner came to ask us about our experience and it made it all the better; it’s refreshing to see someone who cares so much about their business and have them encourage feedback. Just honestly a great place and can’t wait to come back.
GREAT CARNITAS!! Me and my fiancé visited yesterday and ordered some of the best food I’ve ever tasted. Definitely recommend, great prices for the high quality food

We had a lovely time, we sat outside and were provided a space heater for warmth and were waited on by a wonderfully enthusiastic waitress named Raquel, who was very knowledgeable of the area. The food was fantastic and well portioned!

Came across this page on Instagram and decided to check it it for taco Tuesday as well as my friends birthday. Although short staffed for a semi busy night, our server Tony or Toni not sure of the spelling did a phenomenal job taking care of myself and my four friends. The margaritas tasted amazing, their sour mix was amazing (not too tart or too sweet). The food was just as good as the presentation and the location/ambiance was lovely. Oh, the pork belly was amazing! The best I’ve tried this far in the Bay Area.

Unfortunately we did not have a very good experience here. We came across this place and were super excited to try it being some place new that I could show family that was visiting. From the moment we got there our waitress (Asian) sorry didn’t get her name was rushing us to order and seemed annoyed that we had questions about the menu. We got the unlimited and come 1:40 she told us we could not have anymore when I kindly asked if we could have just one more round she rudely replied “NO”, and proceeded to take the empty glasses away from the table. No “oh I’m sorry we cut off early” or anything. She came to the table so we could pay our bills right after that we didn’t even have our cards out or ready yet and she stood there as a way to hurry us along. Disappointing considering the food, location, and atmosphere however the server was not exactly what I would call friendly. With that said I won’t be back.
Just ok food with ok service, nothing great about it
Yes, yes, yes! Tacos were the bomb and so was our server! Loved the music and atmosphere.  I'll be back the next time I'm in Tampa.
Great food

Couldn’t wait to leave from the second I sat down. Terrible acoustics, can’t even have a conversation. House margarita was all sour mix. Taco meat was ripping through the tortillas like a handful of rocks from a koi pond on a wet piece of 8.5x11. Have’t had Mexican this bad in a while. Not a lost cause, do better.  Edit: In response, no there was not too much meat in the tacos. You need to double shell the tortillas.

Great food with an awesome.view, especially if you eat outside. A bit on the pricey side though especially for the neighborhood. The inside is very cool. I recommend a walk along the river after you're done.
So good! Came to Tampa for a weekend trip and so glad we found this place. They have great vegan options and the margaritas! Staff was also super friendly and knowledgeable. Can’t wait to come back!
Food came out very quick and was absolutely delicious!

First time checking this place out but for sure won't be the last. Food and drinks was amazing. Restaurant is in a great location with plenty of parking. Would recommend to anyone looking for a new chill place to eat and drink with friend.

Attempted to check out this place. It looks nice and menu looked good, but walking in they had woman and male bar tender Friday night nov 13. The male bar tender did not have a mask on at all. He did t even have one on his neck. This was around 6-615pm as we wanted to go for happy hour. Due to that we decided to walk out. Shameful as restaurants should be enforcing all their employees to wear mask.
Wanted to try this restaurant but some staff did not have a mask on. They didn’t even try to wear one. Disappointed.

The steak was good, however you get a very small portion of food for 17 dollars. The chips and guacamole were great, however you only get a small bowl for 11 dollars. The food is good but the quality does not match the price. I won't be coming back.

I recently came into XoChitl Mexican cuisine for the first time, which sits just across the street from armature in the bottom of the Pearl building in Tampa heights. From the ridiculously refreshing skinny Margs, to the fresh carnita tacos, I couldn’t have been happier with experience. We were greeted at our table by the chef who was one of the sweetest woman I’ve ever met. She was Personable and humbling and truly passionate about her restaurant and the craft behind her food! The vibe was fun and uplifting and I will absolutely be back! 5 stars from me! ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️

I absolutely love this restaurant from prior times, but I came here recently with my friend and we encountered a rude waiter named Steve G. When he approached us first, he didn’t even say “hello, may I take your order?”, instead he roughly came up and scoffed “are you ready?” I knew we wanted chips and guac so I ordered and finally when he came back, I made sure to make it evident that I was allergic to dairy. I told him I needed a regular enchilada with only chicken due to my allergy, and he obviously didn’t listen since he brought back cheese on my rice and beans and a cream sauce on my enchiladas. I called him back and repeatedly said “I’m sorry but i can’t eat this can you make it without the sauce and cheese?” I said sorry about 5 times and he just stared at me and gruffly took the plate back to the kitchen without reassuring me and saying “it’s fine don’t worry.” On top of that, he forgot to bring our forks and knives so we had to call a different waitress so we could simply eat. What was I supposed to do, lick the plate? Finally when we got our checks, he didn’t say thank you for coming or anything, he just put down the receipts and left. My friend gave him a 0% tip, which he deserved. I’m very disappointed in this waiter, but the food and manager made up for it.

The waitress was very nice and attentive HOWEVER every time she came to our table to speak to us she pulled down her mask!?!?   We were sat outside but felt so uncomfortable as she was standing over us speaking with her mask down on her chin. I don’t get it. By now everyone should be aware of how and when to wear their masks. The food was ok. Please fix the mask issue.
The restaurant is pretty, but fifteen dollars for three small tacos? So overpriced.
Been Here 3 Times already! Great food, great service and a good time for a night out! Esquites are a must have when you go here! The Happy Hour Margaritas will take you away! ;D
Food was great! Definitely going back.
Amazing owner awesome vibes! Loved the fresh nachos and salsa. Drinks are amazing. New place to hang out on a Friday

Loved the artwork made the atmosphere enjoyable. The food was delicious, fresh, and the service was prompt. We went on the all you can drink wine night and it was fun and cup never got empty. We really enjoyed ourselves and will go back

Came in last night with the family and friends to have some drinks and tacos and everything was OUTSTANDING and the service was amazing def will be back and recommending to all my taco and margarita lovers 🌮🍹

username: Champion Mobile Home Brokers/ Rhonda Spurling

caption: Nice colorful interior, attentive service, okay food, bad drinks.

My wife and I and 3 more couples went there late in the night and there was no food service as it was already late, but we were really just looking for a place to have a few drinks and have fun. Well, the drinks were pretty good, but the DJ made the night for us, as she was playing a great salsa lineup and had us all dancing. I would recommend this place when hanging out at Armature works if you are looking  for a place to have fun with friends.
Latino favor in Tampa Heights heart.  Just love it  Friendly staff and latino DJ
Great dishes, great service. Thank You Fernando. We had a wonderful experience.
You will be hard-pressed to find worst customer service in the area.
Excellent food and service. Will go again. Thank you!
It was ok.
Wow what a beautiful place and the food was AMazing . I Will definitely be coming back. Service was just as great and the food was delicious.
This was my first time here and I definitely will be returning.  The place it self was absolutely amazing and the service was just as great.  Love the Art !! Must visit !!
The food is absolutely fantastic and the atmosphere just takes it to another level. We’ll definitely be back!
Came here to celebrate 🍾!!! The owner stopped by a few times to make sure we were enjoying ourselves!!!  Definitely coming back, cant beat the combination of tacos and margaritas!!!

Came in to check this place out based on my friends telling how amazing the food is and craving nachos. Well my friends were right, the food here is amazing, portions are perfect, and the service is on point. I definitely can’t wait to come back and try more items on the menu. I had the steak nachos and shrimp tacos with a side of the bean, rice, & roasted corn.
Service is awful and prices are way too high.. never had a worse experience at a Mexican restaurant.. there are way better options in Tampa to go to.
Great experience! Yummy true Mexican flavors and fun drinks in an enjoyable setting. Worth a second visit soon!

I can’t even say how amazing my experience here was! The food, service, and drinks were all magical! The bar tender made a ‘special’ pitcher of margaritas for us - tell him Elaine & Ann told you about the secret pitcher menu 😉We had the carne asada burritos and nachos. The nachos were huge but delicious! The burrito was on point! We will 100% be back!
Best margarita ever! The carnitas bowl is my fav. The service was great and very welcoming just like Cheers.

We started with fresh house made chips and queso. Loved the tequila flight with my favorite tequila. The steak and pico de Gallo tacos were so fresh tasting!  Excellent! Customer service and ambiance were great. So far, there’s only one other Mexican restaurant in Tampa that is as good.
Great food.. a little bit overpriced.

The service here is great, no complaints. The drinks are also great. That being said, it’s a little a pricey compared to the competition and the food was just ok. Pork was very dry and the tortillas tasted like they were from La Tortilla Factory, which you can find at your local grocery store.  Being a new restaurant, I think if these issues were fixed, it would be a solid 5 stars.
Extremely disappointing.

we came in as a party of 8 with a reservation and the restaurant is completely empty. Even still they messed up every single person's order. The server is clearly new but the other person helping him spent the entire time rolling his eyes, sighing, and belittling him instead of helping to make anything right. We never once saw a manager or had a dollar taken off our bill. They had just opened so I had hoped that was part of the problem but we've had a terrible experience every single time. Clearly overpriced and poorly managed.
Amazing chips and queso. The location is great and the atmosphere was on point. If you like spicy, try the jalapeno margarita.
Best Mexican in Tampa. Authentic, robust flavors, fast and friendly service, amazing margaritas
Great food, service, and drinks!

The food is ok and the kitchen was fast.  However, I don't think, ok, is good enough, based on the prices.   Menu image is below.   Most of the food was  under-seasoned. Interestingly, I feel like the carnitas and chicken used in multiple dishes is cooked separate from those dishes. This is a problem because the biggest problem with the food is lack of seasoning. Example, chicken enchiladas. What would normally be a rich luxurious dish is somewhat bland chicken topped with a tortilla and a smear of mole.  The tacos were the most successful part of the meal.  Unfortunately, we have a lot of good taco places in Tampa.  Value for money is the biggest problem I see.  What you're paying for this food does not stand up to the taste or execution.  The queso fundudo is a hunk of cheese heated atop some chorizo. after a couple of minutes it cools to be a lump of cheese. The guac and pico are great, the fresh fried chips are nice, the the chicken tostadidas tasted okay but needed more acid or salt. The carnitas entree was pretty basic and under-seasoned.  If you want to spend the same money and have an incredible meal, check out oak and ola, across the street, or Rocca a couple doors down.

Lunch today was wonderful. Grouper taco, pollo taco and the house salad with watermelon radishes, watercress, oranges. Perfectly seasoned. Aaron, the bartender was very informative about the food and beverages served at this new restaurant. Dinner menu looks amazing too.

I have to say that whenever a new mexican style restaurant opens I am a bit hesitant to try out it, and let me say two words... handmade tortillas! We tried a few appetizers, tacos and drinks. The bone marrow app was unique and juicy. The pico de gallo is chunky, fresh and will leave you wanting more. The pork belly was perfect. The tacos (Carnitas, Asada, Pork belly, Summer Squash and Chorizo) they were all very good, but my favorites were the Asada and Chorizo. As for drinks we had the red sangria and mango lime margarita both very good, not too sweet and not too overpowering that you felt you wouldnt make the drive home! Overall, a great restaurant and I am looking forward to coming back and trying more of the food.
Amazing drink selection and great taco portions . Can't wait to come back and try every on the menu !

Amazing atmosphere, great seating options. The bar is setup perfectly. Two big tvs and great decore to keep you entertained. Food was amazing and came out promptly. Truly enjoyed the pork belly tacos and Short Rib Entree. Girlfriend had the Pina Colada Margarita and it was absolutely delicious. Will Def be back. #AnchorPham
Great food great service definitely coming back!
Best Really authentic Mexican restaurant in Tampa. Excellent
Fairly good food, service, ect.....
